data.title: “Seabiscuit: An American Legend” by Laura Hillenbrand
data.meta_description: The tale opens with the introduction of the improbable hero, a little, tenacious thoroughbred with an ordinary pedigree named Seabiscuit. Despite all the odds, Seabiscuit, who was born in 1933 in the…
data.text:
Overview:

The tale opens with the introduction of the improbable hero, a little, tenacious thoroughbred with an ordinary pedigree named Seabiscuit. Despite all the odds, Seabiscuit, who was born in 1933 in the midst of the worst of the Great Depression, went on to become one of the most adored and prosperous racehorses in American history.

The Characters:

The main characters, whose lives become entwined with Seabiscuit’s trip, are central to the story. These people are Red Pollard, a gifted but troubled jockey who develops a unique bond with the horse, Tom…
